questions.question: A company surveys its own employees about job satisfaction and reports that 90% are satisfied. What is the main limitation of using this result to claim that most workers in the industry are satisfied?
questions.correct_answer: The sample only includes employees from one company and may not represent the industry
wrong_answers: The sample size is too small to draw any conclusions
Job satisfaction cannot be measured accurately through surveys
The percentage should have been higher to make a valid claim
questions.explanation: The main issue is sampling bias. Surveying only one company's employees does not provide a representative sample of the entire industry. Different companies may have different satisfaction levels.
